In the Khotin direction, Russian forces continued their assault operations towards Kindrativka and have recaptured positions northeast of the village.
After being forced to withdraw over the reservoir, Russian forces crossed it again using rubber boats and gained a foothold in the forest plantations on its southern bank. From there they advanced further, securing the entire southern bank, as well as positions further south along the treeline. 
Meanwhile, Ukrainian forces are attacking towards the road intersection west of Kostyantynivka, attempting to cut off supplies into the village. No confirmed progress has been made here.
+ ~1.81 km¬≤ in favour of Russia.
Footage showing the second Russian Iskander-M striking Kyiv.
Consequences of the two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes on Ukrainian energy infrastructure in Kyiv.
Consequences of the two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes on Ukrainian energy infrastructure in Kyiv.

Last night, a series of Russian attacks were carried out on Kharkiv Oblast.
15 Russian Geran-2 drones struck a target in the area of Pivdenne, just south of Kharkiv City. Media 1 & 2 show some of the explosions that were seen from Kharkiv City. At least 3 Geran-2 drones also impacted the railway station in the city of Lozova. 
Additionally, 6 KAB glide-bombs targeted the industrial zone in northern Kharkiv, as seen in Media 3. The full extent of the damage here is unknown, but 13 civilians were injured due to damage to surrounding apartment buildings.

Last night, a series of Russian attacks were carried out on Kharkiv Oblast.
15 Russian Geran-2 drones struck a target in the area of Pivdenne, just south of Kharkiv City. Media 1 & 2 show some of the explosions that were seen from Kharkiv City. At least 3 Geran-2 drones also impacted the railway station in the city of Lozova. 
Additionally, 6 KAB glide-bombs targeted the industrial zone in northern Kharkiv, as seen in Media 3. The full extent of the damage here is unknown, but 13 civilians were injured due to damage to surrounding apartment buildings.
Consequences of the two Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strikes on Ukrainian energy infrastructure in Kyiv.
Despite firefighting efforts, a massive fire continues to burn in eastern Kyiv from the Iskander strikes.
Despite firefighting efforts, a massive fire continues to burn in eastern Kyiv from the Iskander strikes.

Last night, several Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Ryazan Oil Refinery in Ryazan Oblast.   At least two impacts were recorded, including 1 in the area of the hydrotreating unit and another the AVT-2 primary oil processing unit. Some sources reported that "Peklo"‚Ä¶

Reuters reports that due to the repeated Ukrainian drone strikes on the Ryazan Oil Refinery, the refinery has shut down its main oil processing unit (ATV-4) for three months. 
This unit can produce as much as 4 million metric tons of fuel per year (80,000 barrels per day), which equates to 35-50% of the refinery's total production capacity. In addition to this, nearby units such as a reformer, gasoil hydrotreater, and catalytic cracker were also reportedly temporarily halted due to the damage sustained. 
The Ryazan Oil Refinery is the fourth largest in Russia, and processes approximately 5% of Russia's total refinery output.

Overnight, 2 Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers redeployed from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, to Diaghilev Airbase, Ryazan Oblast.
One An-124-100 "Ruslan" cargo plane landed at Diaghilev Airbase, carrying Kh-101 cruise missiles for the Tu-95MS. To my knowledge, this is the first recorded instance of Russia using Diaghilev Airbase to equip their bombers. 
Meanwhile, 1 Tu-95MS is stationed at Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, and 3 are at Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast. 2 Tu-160s are also stationed at Engels-2. All of these aircraft are equipped with missiles.
There is an increased possibility of the next large-scale, combined missile attack on Ukraine taking place tonight, as large launches of Geran-2 drones are expected to take place.

My interview with AMK mapping is now up.
https://youtu.be/pl3bA4Xh9sI?si=q_LkZzJQN1BnSnKl
My interview with AMK mapping is now up.  https://youtu.be/pl3bA4Xh9sI?si=q_LkZzJQN1BnSnKl
This is my fourth episode on Kalibrated, and its interesting seeing how my views have evolved over time since the first time I appeared on the show in June 2024.

Overnight, 2 Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers redeployed from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, to Diaghilev Airbase, Ryazan Oblast.  One An-124-100 "Ruslan" cargo plane landed at Diaghilev Airbase, carrying Kh-101 cruise missiles for the Tu-95MS. To my knowledge‚Ä¶

There is a significant chance of Russia launching a large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine tonight. 
So far, launches of Geran-2 drones have been recorded (not confirmed) from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast, and Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase, Krasnodar Krai. Additional preparations for launches of Gerna-2/3 drones has been recorded from Navlya Test Site, Bryansk Oblast.
Due to recent accumulations of Geran-2 drones at Millerovo Airbase, the numbers of drones launched from here alone could reach as high as 100. 
Additionally, due to recent deliveries of missiles, there is a high threat of Iskander-M ballistic missile and Iskander-K cruise missile launches from OTRK installations in Bryansk Oblast, Kursk Oblast, and Voronezh Oblast.
For the second time this week, a Russian BM-35 drone struck a wind turbine in Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast. No new power outages are reported.
A Russian BM-35 drone has struck a wind turbine near Kramatorsk, Donetsk Oblast for the third time this week.

There is a significant chance of Russia launching a large-scale, combined missile and drone attack on Ukraine tonight.   So far, launches of Geran-2 drones have been recorded (not confirmed) from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov Oblast, and Primorsko-Akhtarsk Airbase‚Ä¶
Over the past 48 hours, as many as 4 Russian MiG-31Ks have been re-equipped with Kinzhal aeroballistic missiles at Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast. They may be used tonight.
Over the past 48 hours, as many as 4 Russian MiG-31Ks have been re-equipped with Kinzhal aeroballistic missiles at Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast. They may be used tonight.
Here is a map showing the known locations where Russian Iskander-M and Iskander-K OTRK installations are usually situated, as well as the current operational Geran-2 launch points.
Radio activity connected to Russian strategic bombers is recorded at Engels-2 Airbase.
Launches of Russian Geran-2 drones have been recorded from Tsumbulova Test Site, Oryol Oblast. Additional preparations for Geran launches are taking place at Khalino Airbase, Kursk Oblast.
Radio activity connected to Russian strategic bombers is recorded at Engels-2 Airbase.

There are continued communications between Moscow and Engels-2 Airbase. Additional activity is recorded at Diaghilev Airbase, which is also communication with Moscow.
Departures of at least five Tu-95MS bombers are expected in the next few hours.

Ukrainian Reserves Shortage: Russian Forces Press Offensive On Seven Fronts
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, full control of the village of Pershotravneve was established following a successful crossing of the Yangach River. Russian units have reached the eastern outskirts of Mirnohrad and consolidated their positions in the west of Rodinske. 
The decision on the use of frozen Russian assets has been postponed until the next EU summit.

U.S. Deploys Its Latest Aircraft Carrier In Caribbean, Targets Another Boat Near Venezuela (Video) 
The Pentagon on October 24 ordered the deployment of the USS Gerald R. Ford Carrier Strike Group to the Caribbean Sea to support operations against drug cartels there, amid reports suggesting that President Donald Trump was nearing a decision on launching strikes against Venezuela.
The strike group docked near the harbor of Split, Croatia, on October 21. That is more than 4,300 nautical miles from the Caribbean, meaning it would take days for the group to be in position to launch any strikes.
The announcement of the carrier strike group deployment came just hours after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said that the U.S. military had struck another alleged drug-smuggling boat in the Caribbean.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Captures Rodynske And Advances In Pokrovsk, Causing Panic In Ukraine (Videos) 
On October 25, the Russian military captured a key settlement located to the north of Pokrovsk, and expanded its control within the city itself, causing panic in the ranks of Kiev forces.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces has reportedly captured Rodynske and most of its outskirts to the north of Pokrovsk. Russian troops reached the route to the west of the settlement which links Pokrovsk with Dobropillya further to the north.
In Pokrovsk itself, the Tsentr Group of Forces made additional gains. Russian troops captured most of the city‚Äôs western entrance, advanced further to the north of the railroad in the center of the city, and reached the settlement of Rih, or Rig, to the east.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Northern Palestine On October 25, 2025 (Map Update)

Russian Army Advances In Vovchansk, Ukraine Murders Own Troops Near Kupyansk (Videos, Photos)
On October 25, the Russian military advanced in Vovchansk, and made a breakthrough close to Kupyansk as Ukraine stepped up efforts to prevent its troops from abandoning their positions in the Khakriv direction.
The Sever [North] Group of Forces has reportedly advanced in the western part of Vovchansk, mainly along the streets of Obozna and Zaliznychna. Russian troops are close to blocking the southern entrance of the key settlement, which would prevent Ukraine from sending supplies from Bilyi Kolodyaz.
Moving to the south in Kharkiv, the Zapad [West] Group of Forces continue to battle Kiev forces inside Kupyansk and in nearby areas.
Most of the city is already under the control of Russian troops. Ukraine is doing everything possible to force its troops to fight there.
Read more
